metadata.name: Item
metadata.short-description: Describes an item on the file system

export.property:
Boolean Whether or not the {df:commonName} exists Whether or not the {df:commonName} exists on disk.
If there is an item of the same name which isn't a {df:commonName}, returns false. SAMPLES
export.method:
[Boolean forgiving] If true:
  • If the parent doesn't exist, make() doesn't throw and creates the parent folder and any missing parent folder.
  • If there is already an item of the same name, only throws if the item is not a {df:commonName}. If it is a {df:commonName}, does not modify it.
self Creates the {df:commonName} Creates the {df:commonName} based on its path.
Throws if the parent doesn't exist, or if there is already an item at that path. SAMPLES

Folder destination, [Boolean forgiving] The folder in which to create the copy. If true, if destination doesn't exist, copyTo() doesn't throw and creates destination and any missing parent folder. {df:$classname} Copies the {df:commonName} to a folder Copies the {df:commonName} into the destination folder, and returns a {df:$classname} object representing the copy.
Throws if there already exists an item of the same name at the destination, or if the destination doesn't exist. SAMPLES

[String newName] The name to use for the copy instead of an automatically-picked one. duplicate() will throw if the name is taken. {df:$classname} Duplicates the {df:commonName} in place. Creates a copy of the {df:commonName} in the same folder, and returns a {df:$classname} object representing the copy. The name of the copy is derived from the {df:commonName}'s name. SAMPLES

method.name: delete
method.argument: If true, the {df:commonName} is deleted right away instead of being placed in the trash.
method.discussion:
Deletes the {df:commonName} by moving it to the user's trash.
Relies on the trash package.
method.sample: const keepLog = await cli.ask('Keep log file?', Boolean); if (!keepLog) here.file('events.log').delete();
